training_organizations.name: Arkansas DCFS & MidSOUTH Training Academy
training_organizations.description: A partnership between the Arkansas Division of Children and Family Services and the University of Arkansas (MidSOUTH) to train the state’s child welfare staff. New investigators and family service workers attend the academy for instruction in Arkansas law, investigative techniques, and family-centered practice.

training_organizations.name: The CALL (Children of Arkansas Loved for a Lifetime)
training_organizations.description: A faith-based nonprofit that recruits, trains, and supports foster and adoptive parents across Arkansas. The CALL works alongside DCFS to increase the number of available foster homes and expedite the placement of children with qualified families, effectively expanding foster care capacity in the state.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.TribalReport: No, there are no Tribes within the state
policies.TribalScreen: No, there are no Tribes within the state
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Abuse includes physical abuse, emotional abuse, exposure to a drug lab, illegal substances, trafficking, female genital mutilation, and Munchausen syndrome by proxy (Factitious disorder by proxy)
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes failure to protect, malnourishment, inadequate clothing/shelter, medical neglect, injurious environment, inadequate supervision, educational neglect, prenatal exposure, injurious environment, and abandonment
policies.Exempt_OtherSpecify: A child maltreatment investigation will have an individual finding of "true but exempt," which means the offender's name will not be placed in the child maltreatment central registry for underaged juvenile offenders if there is an overall true finding of sexual abuse by a child under the age of 14 to another child; Prenatal exposure to drugs or alcohol is considered "true but exempt" through Garret's Law, resulting in a protective services case to create a plan of safe care; When a child suffers transient pain or minor temporary marks as the result of an appropriate restraint
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Domestic abuse advocate; Employee of child advocacy center or child safety center; Sexual abuse advocate; Rape crisis advocate; A child abuse advocate; Victim or witness coordinator; Victim assistance professional; An individual employed by a nonprofit charitable organization other than a nonprofit hospital; Child Welfare Ombudsman; A coach or director of a public or private nonathletic organization, team, or club; A licensed massage therapist; A person who is 18 years of age or older and observes abuse, sexual abuse, or sexual exploitation of a child
policies.ReportInfo_OtherSpecify: Potential danger to staff assessing the report; Current risk of harm to the child; Identity and location of possible witnesses or persons knowledgeable about the alleged child maltreatment; Licensing authority and facility involved if applicable
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Current risk of harm to the child; Identity and location of possible witnesses or persons knowledgeable about the alleged child maltreatment; Licensing authority and facility involved, if applicable; Potential danger to staff assessing the report
policies.DefAge_VaryByTypeSpecify: The criteria for what constituents sexual abuse varies by type of perpetrator, age of perpetrator, and depending on the perpetrator's age, the child's age varies from under age 15 to under age 18; Educational neglect applies to children between the ages of 6 and 17; Shaking a child applies to children 3 and younger; Striking a child on the face or head applies to children 6 and younger
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: For sexual abuse, the perpetrator can include any person (including teens) as well as caretakers
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: New staff training occurs within the first year and includes courses on foundational practices, dynamics of child maltreatment, assessment strategies, family engagement, safety, permanency and well-being, and additional concentrations
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Domestic abuse advocate; Employee of child advocacy center or child safety center; Sexual abuse advocate; Rape crisis advocate; A child abuse advocate; Victim or witness coordinator; Victim assistance professional; An individual employed by a nonprofit charitable organization other than a nonprofit hospital; Child Welfare Ombudsman; A coach or director of a public or private nonathletic organization, team, or club; A licensed massage therapist; A person who is 18 years of age or older and observes abuse, sexual abuse, or sexual exploitation of a child
policies.InvestReq_MHEvalCases_Specify: Impairment of the intellectual, emotional, or psychological development as evidenced by observable and substantial reduction in the child's ability to function within a normal range of performance and behavior; Suffered a substantial impairment in the ability to function as a result of a specific, non-accidental action or interaction committed by a parent or caretaker
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: 5 years of child welfare experience can substitute for the degree requirement
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Physical abuse; Sexual abuse; Neglect; Burns, fractures or dislocations in children under three years of age; Burns, fractures or dislocations in children of any age if unexplained or implausibly explained; Burns, bruises, or fractures in non-ambulatory children; Reasonable suspicion that vaginal or oral penetration has occurred; Cases involving sexually transmitted diseases in prepubescent children; Cases of malnutrition and failure to thrive; Cases of serious medical neglect; Cases of alleged head and abdominal injuries (regardless of presence of visible injury); Reports in which the child has an observable injury, the caretaker admits responsibility for the injury and there is reason to believe that there are internal injuries or other injuries which have occurred in the past
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: New staff training occurs within the first year and includes courses on foundational practices, dynamics of child maltreatment, assessment strategies, family engagement, safety, permanency and well-being, and additional concentrations
policies.InvestReq_ReporterCases_Specify: The investigator may interview collateral sources, as appropriate, including teachers, neighbors, witnesses, and the reporter
policies.AltResp_Eligibility_OtherSpecify: All of the following factors must be present for a report to be assigned to Differential Response: (1) identifying information for the family members and their current address or a means to locate them is known at the time of the report, (2) the alleged perpetrators are parents, birth or adoptive, legal guardians, custodians, or any person standing in loco parentis, (3) the family has no pending investigation or open protective services or supportive services case, (4) the alleged victims, siblings or other household members, are not currently in the care and custody of Arkansas Department of Children and Family Services or wards of the court, (5) protective custody of the children has not been taken or required in the current investigation
